p: Recently, Cu 1.8S has also been paid significant attention in sodium-ion batteries and lithium-ion batteries owing to its crystallographic stability and narrow band gap of 1.2 eV (better electrical conductivity) [ 42, 50, 51]. Zaworotko and Ryan et al. reported that Cu 1.8S/C-500 nanowire composites exhibited the best performance, and showed a specific capacity up to 220 mAh g −1 after 200 cycles [ 50]. Kang and Lee et al. reported that a nanoporous Cu 1.8S-C/C core/shell anode structure with a high surface area achieved a specific capacity of 372 mAh g −1 after 110 cycles with a performance of ~93% capacity retention [ 42]. Chen and Lou et al. reported that a designed 3D core-shell Cu 1.8S/C@MoS 2 nanocomposite exhibited good stability, outstanding rate performance, and high reversible capacity, because of the assistance of Cu 1.8S/C [ 44].
